oneOf.description: Simple: 1 single period during the day, with no energy price differentiation.
Bi-hourly: 2 periods during the day (off-peak and peak hours)
Tri-hourly: 3 periods during the day (peak hours, mid-peak hours, and off-peak hours)
Daily cycle: the hourly periods are the same every day of the year.
Weekly cycle: the hourly periods differ between weekdays and weekends.
Simple: 1 single period during the day, with no energy price differentiation.

egme_tariff.description: The Regulation for Electric Mobility foresees the billing by the Electric Mobility Network Managing Entity of a tariff (“EGME tariff”) which covers the costs of its regulated activity, applied to EMSPs, CPOs and DPCs. These costs are verified by ERSE in the process of setting this tariff annually. The EGME tariff does not have a direct application to the Users, given that these tariffs are applicable to market participants, although they represent costs for the EMSP and CPO, they may adjust the tariffs that they practice.

public_funding.description: State Support for Electric Mobility: The support translates into a discount applicable to the cost of each charge registered in the national electric mobility network and assumes the value of € 0,1684 for each charge.

iec.description: The Special Tax on Electricity Consumption (IEC) is composed by a variable term applied to electricity consumption, with the rate being, in Mainland Portugal, of 0,001 € by kWh, under the terms of Decree no. 320-D/2011, from 30 of December.

last_updated.description: Timestamp when this Tariff was last updated (or created).
